header.gameNote: LAS VEGAS CLASSIC AT LAS VEGAS NV

article.headline: Maryland-Eastern Shore 74, Charleston Southern 49
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Ed Tyson had a game-high 20 points with six rebounds and five assists to lead Maryland-Eastern Shore past Charleston Southern 74-49 in the final round of the Las Vegas Classic on Saturday. The Hawks also were helped by Antonio McMillion and Corey Brown who each had 19 points. Aleksander Popovic added 12 points and a game-high 12 rebounds for Maryland-Eastern Shore in the eight-team, four-game tournament. After leading 49-47 with 12:27 left in the game, the Hawks went on a 19-0 run as the Buccaneers went scoreless for the next 9:17. Charleston Southern did not score a field goal in the final 13:06, only scoring 15 second-half points. Chris Moore led the Buccaneers (5-8) with 12 points, including 4-of-7 from 3-point range. Donnell Covington had 10 points for Charleston Southern. Maryland-Eastern Shore shot 31-of-59 from the field for 53 percent, while Charleston Southern was 16-of-54 for 30 percent. The Hawks went 1-3 in the Classic after winning the seventh-place game Saturday, while the Buccaneers were 0-4.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
